meanings.definition: To descend from a higher to a lower place
meanings.sent1: I watch the leaves fall from the tree.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to fall off the ladder.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to fall gracefully from the shelf.
meanings.sent4: Her tears fall like raindrops from her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The snowflakes fall softly to the ground.

meanings.definition: To come down suddenly from a standing position
meanings.sent1: I trip and fall on the slippery floor.
meanings.sent2: The child fell while running in the park.
meanings.sent3: The clown pretended to fall for a laugh.
meanings.sent4: His hopes fall like a house of cards.
meanings.sent5: The raindrops fall heavily on the roof.

meanings.definition: The season between summer and winter
meanings.sent1: I love the colors of the leaves in fall.
meanings.sent2: During fall, the weather gets cooler.
meanings.sent4: The fall of the leaves marks the season change.
meanings.sent5: The fall breeze carries a hint of winter chill.

meanings.definition: A decrease in value or quantity
meanings.sent1: The fall in prices attracted many buyers.
meanings.sent2: There was a sudden fall in the stock market.
meanings.sent3: The fall in attendance was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: His fall from grace was swift and public.
meanings.sent5: The fall of the empire was inevitable.
